member.name: T:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.TriggerID
member.summary: Defines all triggers that can be available in the system.

member.name: T:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.TriggerState
member.summary: Defines the different states of a trigger.

member.name: F:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.TriggerState.STAGE1
member.summary: Trigger is in stage 1 pressed state.

member.name: F:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.TriggerState.STAGE2
member.summary: Trigger is in stage 2 pressed state.

member.name: T:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.TriggerDevice
member.summary: The Symbol.ResourceCoordination.TriggerDevice class provides access to the triggers available in the system.
member.remarks: The TriggerDevice class provides an excellent starting point for applications that wish to gain more information about all the triggers available. The AvailableTriggers property provides a static Device array with each entry mapping to available trigger buttons. Each entry contains information about the hardware and can also be used to construct a object. This is the recommended method for instantiating Trigger objects.

member.name: M:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.TriggerDevice.#ctor(Symbol.ResourceCoordination.TriggerID,Symbol.ResourceCoordination.TriggerState[])
member.summary: Constructs a TriggerDevice instance using an ID and a list of available stages.
member.param: A TriggerID enumerated type that defines the trigger in the system.
A TriggerState enumerated type array that contains the triggers supported stages.

member.name: M:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.TriggerDevice.#ctor(Symbol.ResourceCoordination.TriggerID,System.Collections.ArrayList)
member.summary: Constructs a TriggerDevice instance using an ID and a list of available stages.
member.param: A TriggerID enumerated type that defines the trigger in the system.
A ArrayList that contains the triggers supported stages.

member.name: P:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.TriggerDevice.ID
member.summary: Returns the ID of the trigger device.
member.value: A TriggerID enumerated type member that indicates the ID of the trigger.

member.name: P:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.TriggerDevice.AvailableStages
member.summary: Gets a list of stages available to the trigger device.
member.value: An array of TriggerStates that provide information about the stages that the trigger supports.

member.name: P:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.TriggerDevice.AvailableTriggers
member.summary: Gets a list of triggers available on the system.
member.remarks: The AvailableTriggers property interrogates the system for information about the available triggers. It is recommended that TriggerDevice objects obtained from this array be used to construct Trigger objects.
member.value: An array of TriggerDevice objects the contain information about all available triggers in the system.

member.summary: Both speaker and beeper are supported

member.name: T:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.CCDTypes
member.remarks: Deprecated. Use CameraTypes instead.

member.name: T:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.RegionCodes
member.summary: Define Possible Region Codes. Will not list the individual country code but it will begin with 0x8xxx:xxxx.

member.name: M:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.Version.#ctor
member.remarks: Normally called by the class library and returned by the TerminalInfo.ResCoordVersion property.

member.name: P:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.Version.CAPIVersion
member.summary: Gets the CAPI version of resource coordinator.

member.name: P:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.Version.AssemblyVersion
member.summary: Gets the version of this assembly.

member.name: P:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.Version.ResCoordVersion
member.summary: Gets the version of resource coordinator driver.

member.name: T:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.RegisteredTriggerInfo
member.summary: A structure that contains information about an exclusively registered trigger and its stage.

member.name: F:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.RegisteredTriggerInfo.device
member.summary: A TriggerDevice object that defines which trigger to register.

member.name: F:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.RegisteredTriggerInfo.registeredStage
member.summary: A TriggerState enumerated type member that defines which stage to register.

member.name: T:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.Trigger
member.summary: The Trigger class provides the capability of performing actions on the trigger and obtaining information (including notification messages) about the trigger.
member.remarks: The Trigger class is the primary class of the Symbol.ResourceCoordination class assembly. It provides information about the associated hardware trigger, as well as the capability of registering for event notification.

member.name: M:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.Trigger.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a Trigger instance using the default trigger device. The first available hardware trigger is used by the trigger object.

member.name: M:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.Trigger.#ctor(Symbol.ResourceCoordination.TriggerDevice)
member.summary: Constructs a Trigger instance given the specified trigger device.
member.remarks: This is the recommended method for creating trigger objects.
member.param: A TriggerDevice object that defines which trigger to use.

member.name: M:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.Trigger.Finalize
member.summary: Allows a Trigger to attempt to free resources and perform other cleanup operations before it is reclaimed by garbage collection.

member.name: M:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.Trigger.Dispose
member.summary: Call this method to free any resources used by the Trigger object.
member.remarks: It is recommended that this method be called when the application will no longer need the Trigger object.

member.name: M:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.Trigger.makeTriggerEventArgs(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Make a TriggerEventArgs object for the Trigger Event

member.name: P:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.Trigger.State
member.summary: Gets the current the state of the trigger.
member.value: A TriggerState enumerated type member that defines the current state of the trigger.

member.name: P:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.Trigger.ID
member.summary: Gets the ID of the trigger.
member.value: A TriggerID enumerated type member that defines the ID of the trigger.

member.name: P:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.Trigger.AvailableStages
member.summary: Gets a list of stages available to this trigger.
member.value: A TriggerState array that contains a list of supported states.

member.name: P:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.Trigger.IsStage1Supported
member.summary: Return value indicates if Stage1 is supported by this trigger.
member.value: A boolean flag that specifies whether or not Stage1 is supported by the trigger.

member.name: P:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.Trigger.IsStage2Supported
member.summary: Return value indicates if Stage2 is supported by this trigger.
member.value: A boolean flag that specifies whether or not Stage2 is supported by the trigger.

member.name: P:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.Trigger.IsStage1InUse
member.summary: Specifies if Stage1 of the trigger is already exclusively registered.
member.value: A boolean flag that when set to true indicates that the Stage1 has been exclusively registered.

member.name: P:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.Trigger.IsStage2InUse
member.summary: Specifies if Stage2 of the trigger is already exclusively registered.
member.value: A boolean flag that when set to true indicates that the Stage2 has been exclusively registered.

member.name: P:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.Trigger.IsExclusive
member.summary: Flag indicating that exclusive use of specified triggers is requested.
member.remarks: Must be set before an event handler function is attached.
member.value: A boolean flag the specifies the exclusive use of trigger when registered.

member.name: P:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.Trigger.RegisteredTriggers
member.summary: Gets information about all the triggers and stages that are exclusively registered.
member.value: An array of RegisteredTriggerInfo structures.

member.name: E:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.Trigger.Stage1Notify
member.summary: Provides access to the events generated when the trigger enters the Stage1 state.

member.name: E:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.Trigger.Stage2Notify
member.summary: Provides access to the events generated when the trigger enters the Stage2 state.

member.name: T:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.Trigger.TriggerEventHandler
member.summary: Delegate of the event handler of the trigger stage notify events.
member.remarks: Create a delegate of this type from using method in your application with the same prototype. That delegate can then be attached to the stage notification events.

member.name: T:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.TriggerEventArgs
member.summary: Defines arguments passed with trigger stage notify events.
member.remarks: The TriggerEventArgs class provides access to information about the specific notification event that occurred.

member.name: M:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.TriggerEventArgs.#ctor(Symbol.ResourceCoordination.TriggerState,Symbol.ResourceCoordination.TriggerState,Symbol.ResourceCoordination.TriggerID)
member.summary: TriggerEventArgs constructor with settable previous state and new state.
member.remarks: The TriggerEventArgs class in not normally constructed by the application. It usually created by the class library and passed to the application during the event notification process.
member.param: Denotes the prior state of the trigger.
Denotes the current state of the trigger.
TriggerID of the trigger related to this state change.

member.name: P:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.TriggerEventArgs.PreviousState
member.value: A TriggerState enumerated type member.

member.name: P:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.TriggerEventArgs.NewState
member.summary: Trigger stage after the event (the current state at the time of processing).
member.value: A TriggerState enumerated type member.

member.name: P:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.TriggerEventArgs.TriggerID
member.summary: The TriggerID of the trigger related to this state change.
member.remarks: When two triggers are pressed simultaneously, the resulting Trigger ID value could be outside the predefined set of values in the TriggerID enumeration.

member.name: T:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.ConfigType
member.summary: Defines the different types of configuration data that may be available.

member.name: F:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.ConfigType.S24
member.remarks: Deprecated. Use WLAN instead.

member.name: F:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.ConfigType.CCD
member.remarks: Deprecated. Use CAMERA instead.

member.name: F:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.ConfigType.CONFIG_PARAM_DATA_OFFSET
member.summary: For Internal Use (The same as DATA_OFFSET.)

member.name: F:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.ConfigType.DATA_OFFSET
member.summary: For Internal Use (The same as CONFIG_PARAM_DATA_OFFSET.)

member.name: T:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.TerminalInfo
member.summary: The TerminalInfo class provides miscellaneous information about the Symbol mobile device.
member.remarks: When an object of TerminalInfo type is created, access is provided to the mobile device's unique identifier, configuration data (if present), Electronic Serial Number (if present), Smart Battery Status (if present) and RCM version information in the underlying driver stack.

member.name: P:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.TerminalInfo.UniqueUnitID
member.summary: Gets the unique unit ID of the device.
member.value: A byte array that contains the unique unit ID.

member.name: P:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.TerminalInfo.ResCoordVersion
member.summary: Returns a object with information about the underlying RCM driver stack.
member.value: A ResourceCoordination Version object.

member.name: P:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.TerminalInfo.ConfigData
member.summary: Returns a ConfigData object that contains information about the mobile devices configuration.
member.remarks: Not all devices provide configuration data.
member.value: A ConfigData object.

member.name: P:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.TerminalInfo.ESN
member.summary: Gets the Electronic Serial Number of the device.
member.remarks: Not all devices have an Electronic Serial Number.
member.value: The Electronic Serial Number string.

member.name: P:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.TerminalInfo.SmartBatteryStatus
member.summary: Returns a object with the current status of the Smart Battery.
member.remarks: Not all devices with Smart Batteries can provide Battery Status. Refresh method can be called on the object to get the most current status information.
member.value: A SmartBatteryStatus object.

member.name: T:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.ConfigData
member.summary: The ConfigData class provides information about the terminal.
member.remarks: Not all terminals provide configuration data. The configuration data (if present) can be used to determine what hardware is present on the terminal.

member.name: M:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.ConfigData.GetConfigData(System.Int32)
member.summary: A generic config data function that can take in any cfgtype and return the appropriate config data. Used to obtain config data for new config types that are not yet fully defined.
member.param: A integer that specifies the type of config data to retrieve.
member.returns: An integer that contains the config data.

member.name: P:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.ConfigData.SCANNER
member.summary: Returns config data associated with scanner.
member.value: An integer that contains config data. -1 indicates that this information is not available.

member.name: T:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.MfgDate
member.summary: MfgDate structure contains the manufacturing month, day and year of the Smart Battery.

member.name: P:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.MfgDate.Month
member.summary: A byte containing the Manufacturing Month of the Battery.

member.name: P:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.MfgDate.Day
member.summary: A byte containing the Manufacturing Day of the Battery.

member.name: P:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.MfgDate.Year
member.summary: A short containing the Manufacturing Year of the Battery.

member.name: T:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.SmartBatteryStatus
member.summary: SmartBatteryStatus provides access to the Smart Battery information.
member.remarks: Not all terminals provide configuration data. The Smart Battery Status (if present) can be used to determine the status of the battery in the terminal. SmartBatteryStatus provides information on Charge Cycle Count, Serial Number, Symbol Part Number, Manufacturing Date and Rated Capacity.

member.name: P:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.SmartBatteryStatus.BatterySerialNumber
member.value: A string containing the Battery Serial Number.

member.name: P:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.SmartBatteryStatus.BatteryPartNumber
member.value: A string containing the Battery Part Number.

member.name: P:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.SmartBatteryStatus.ChargeCycles
member.summary: Returns number of Battery Charge Cycles (Aggregate charge / Rated Capacity).
member.value: A short containing the number of Battery Charge Cycles.

member.name: P:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.SmartBatteryStatus.RatedCapacity
member.summary: Returns the rated Battery Capacity in mAh.
member.value: A short containing the number of Battery Capacity in mAh.

member.name: P:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.SmartBatteryStatus.BatteryMfgDate
member.summary: Returns a MfgDate structure containing the month, day and year the battery was manufactured.
member.value: A MfgDate structure containing the month, day and year the battery was manufactured.

member.name: P:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.SmartBatteryStatus.StateOfHealth
member.summary: Returns the state of health information.
member.value: A numeric value indicating the battery state of health. 0x64 is healthy and 0xFE is unhealthy.

member.name: F:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.RCM_VERSION_INFO.StructInfo
member.summary: Sub-structure describing memory allocated and used by this structure.

member.name: F:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.STRUCT_INFO.dwAllocated
member.summary: Size of the allocated structure, in bytes.

member.name: F:Symbol.ResourceCoordination.STRUCT_INFO.dwUsed
member.summary: Amount of memory the structure actually uses, in bytes.
